Articles.Content: Jeb is currently in Jool orbit headed for a Vall-Vall-Bop slingshot on day 4800 of his tier 0 grand tour, trying to decide if 6 fuel tanks remaining is enough to get to Eeloo and Dres before heading home.

My career Jeb is stuck orbiting Laythe... ran out of fuel for a return or a landing on Laythe lol

More of the same...here you see him flexing his neck muscles (landing legs bug) while waiting for Bob and Bill to come pick him up.

He is currently managing operations on Valhalla...

I thought you had killed him for a second.
He is currently wallowing in sorrow back at the KSC after returning from minmus and finding it isn't actually made of icecream.

my jeb is preparing for a mun mission in an untested apollo-styled spacecraft. only the launcher itself is tested. the munar module is bug-ridden but i had to fulfill jeb's hope of going to the mun asap. doing pre-launch checks of munar module.

In my timeline he is celebrating the first Mun landing and return which he flew. He has told the engineers to build a space station around Duna and he is disappointed that docking ports have not been invented yet

In my timeline he is celebrating the first Mun landing and return which he flew. He has told the engineers to build a space station around Duna and he is disappointed that docking ports have not been invented yet

At least you didn't do what I did... I first sent up a refueling rocket to minmus. Then lifted a lander and sent it to the mun, gathered my samples and did this that and the other there and went on to minmus in the same trip. Took off from minmus and met up with my refueler only to realize I had no way of getting the fuel transfered as I had no ports... because they hadn't been invented yet ><

Kirk is still up there floating around. I am deciding if I am going to try and rescue his pod with KAS or stay vanilla and go up with a hitchiker can to get him and abandon his research.

Chilling out on the moon, playing pranks on his underlings.

After it was decided that soil samples are cool and all, but pretty dull; Jeb invented a game called 'Kerbal Skittles' in which you use your jetpack's forward momentum to knock over a space buddy.

Planning permission to bring 10 kerbals to the moon is... being considered.

At the very moment this screenshot was taken, young Maganja Kerman finally understood why Bill hurriedly pushed him into that two man lander. He did think it was odd that Bill was prepped for launch at the time, come to think of it.

Edited October 29, 2013 by Toastie_Buns
Wrong underling

*snip*

Chilling out on the moon, playing pranks on his underlings.

After it was decided that soil samples are cool and all, but pretty dull; Jeb invented a game called 'Kerbal Skittles' in which you use your jetpack's forward momentum to knock over a space buddy.

Planning permission to bring 10 kerbals to the moon is... being considered.

At the very moment this screenshot was taken, young Maganja Kerman finally understood why Bill hurriedly pushed him into that two man lander. He did think it was odd that Bill was prepped for launch at the time, come to think of it.

I used to play kerbal horseshoes on the mun. What I would do is when I am about 1-1.5km away from the shuttle I would get going in my jetpack then hit the ground at about 500m and see who would roll closest to the lander.

THat said my Jeb is dead. Well for now. I left his pod (failed launch) where it landed, which was just off the end of the runway. I then went on a test flight for a plane, clipped the pod with the wing on takeoff and because I swore off reverts (unless something that looked like it wasn't my fault happened) I Had to let it go. Wasn't until I went to recover jeb that I realized what I had hit was his command pod.

Fell off a Mun rocket during ascent. Turns out you need additional ladders to hold on to if you want to get an EVA report from the low atmosphere. Who knew?

I think the rocket is still up there somewhere.

Same thing happened to me. XD

He just lead the team on the first Duna mission, successfully landed with a borderline amount of DV left, return to orbit is questionable, however a large armada of equipment was launched after the mission, so they will soon have a little caravan, a Kethane miner, and a menagerie of rovers to keep them company if they are stuck.

Jeb is currently strapped into the tiniest manned rover I've made, he's named it the Jebroller and won't let Bob or Bill have a go in it.

I just got him back to Kerbin after sending a rescue mission in my Let's Play Kerbal Space Program Career Mode Episode Three. He got stranded in orbit around the Mun after running out of gas... SPOILER: He's home now. =)

Video included:

Jeb?

He got promoted to a desk job....designing a NERVA ship.

I'm considering demoting him and sending him on a manned mission to Dres.
I got so sick of Jeb trying to stow away on test designs and bumping other crew from scheduled flights, that I no longer allow orange suits to fly missions.
On an escape shuttle due to an unplanned dis-assembly of the space station he was stationed in.
My Jeb is awaiting launch on the first manned Mun mission on this save.

jeb version 13... Orbiting the sun

Jeb version 17... hard water landing... real hard

jeb 18... duna... forever

jeb 19... Orbital buggy around minmus... don't ask

Jeb 20... primary kerbin to Duna shuttle pilot... 13 completed round trips

Jeb 21... taking year off

jeb 22 ... primary science pilot ... just finished second docking with KerbinLab 1 in LKO... on the short list for the first Duna Mission.

Alacrity
At the moment my Jeb is on Kerbin taking polar samples at North Station. One of 20 small colonies I have around Kerbin, 2 on munar and one on minimus. UPWARD AND ONWARDS!

So I forgot to swap Jeb out with some lackey for the test Rover mission today. Landed a little hard, and broke the wheels on the rover. No big deal right? So, I hop Jeb out and start to repair the wheels. When I fixed the first wheel, the rover starts freaking out all on its own. It starts spinning like a top on the nose, then catches a wheel and careens off into the local hills to erupt in a giant ball of parts and fire. Spec-freakin'-tacular. I almost pee'd myself laughing so hard. I think if you have a 'brake' ag on the rear wheels, and you set the brakes before jumping out to repair the wheels, this happens. I'm still in testing.

Meanwhile, Jeb has been rescued and has sent the lackeys off to Eve. He's in the bar having drinks now.

Jeb fell asleep at the controls and missed the intercept with Minmus.

Now Bill will be the first Kerbin on Minmus.
Jeb was on Duna and now he got freetime
My Jeb is stuck on the Mun. No fuel left for the return, but Bill and Bob are on the way to get him home. At least he wass the first on the mun (for lots of days

Currently orbiting Kerbin on my science station (using the KSP Interstellar mod), along with 4 other Kerbals. Tonight I will be transferring the crew to a new ship which is due to do a grand tour of the other planets

Sandbox:

He's on Eve, waiting for KSC to send him somewhere to stay until we can send a lander. The lander landed in the water, and had an Issue trying to hover to shore, and exploded. So, Jeb's just standing there, looking out at the wreckage.

Career:

KSC, and also dead at the bottom of an ocean. I'm not sure how he got back.

First in space, first rocket, first to land on the Mun, first fatality, first to land on and return from Minimus. And I'm aiming for him to be the first out of Kerbin's SOI, once I figure out how to get the rocket stacked with probes and out there.
Stuck on Moho with Bill this time, a few 100 dV short to hit Kerbin.
